headline.print_headline: As Colombia Pursues Peace, a Former Girl Soldier Seeks a Path
headline.main: A Former Girl Soldier in Colombia Finds ‘Life Is Hard’ as a Civilian

snippet: Charting a future for thousands of young rebel fighters like Mélida is vital to the success of any deal to end 50 years of armed conflict, analysts say.
abstract: Story of former child soldier Melida, who was recruited at age 9 by Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, highlights uncertain future many young rebel fighters face as country's government nears peace agreement with Colombian rebel group; country is divided over role rebels should have in society, and former child soldiers, many of whom were abducted, are particularly unprepared for return to civilian world after knowing little else but war.
